meanings.definition: To stretch out or reach out
meanings.sent1: I reik my arms to grab the book from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to reik its body when waking up from a nap.
meanings.sent3: She had to reik her legs to reach the pedals in the car.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches reik towards the sky in search of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals reik out to catch the raindrops.

meanings.definition: To make something clean or tidy
meanings.sent1: I reik the table before setting it for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to reik her room every Saturday morning.
meanings.sent3: He decided to reik his workspace before starting the project.
meanings.sent4: The maid will reik the hotel room before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent5: The students will reik the classroom after the art project.

meanings.sent1: The reik of fresh bread filled the bakery.
meanings.sent2: The reik of flowers in the garden was delightful.
meanings.sent3: The reik of the garbage truck made him hold his nose.
meanings.sent4: The reik of perfume lingered in the air after she left.
meanings.sent5: The reik of the campfire brought back memories of summer nights.
